Full documentation <https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/mkfifo> or available locally via: info '(coreutils) mkfifo invocation'
DESCRIPTION: Create named pipes (FIFOs) with the given NAMEs.
Mandatory arguments to long options are mandatory for short options too.
-m, --mode=MODE set file permission bits to MODE, not a=rw - umask
-Z     set the SELinux security context to default type
--context[=CTX] like -Z, or if CTX is specified then set the SELinux or SMACK security context to CTX
NAME: mkfifo - make FIFOs (named pipes)
